Question.Text: A 62-Year-Old Woman from Ethiopia with difficulties chewing. She has been fit and well in the past.

Answer: Tetanus - The previously healthy woman from Ethiopia presents with difficulty chewing (trismus/lockjaw). The images show characteristic risus sardonicus (grimacing facial expression from facial muscle spasm) and tetanic spasms. Tetanus is caused by Clostridium tetani exotoxin from wound contamination, causing progressive muscle rigidity and painful spasms starting with masseter muscles (lockjaw), requiring urgent management with antitoxin and supportive care.
